raw_text:
Beckham relief as Real go through
 
 David Beckham expressed his relief at Real Madrid's passage to the Champions League knockout phase.
 
 After Real's 3-0 win at Roma, the England skipper admitted another season of under-achievement would not be tolerated at the Bernabeu stadium. Beckham said: "It's expected of Madrid to get through, but it's a relief for the club and players to have won. "We lost momentum last season but we cannot afford to to go another season without winning anything." Real's finish as runners-up in their Champions League group means they cannot face his old club Manchester United in the next round. But Real could be drawn against other Premiership hopefuls, Arsenal or Chelsea, who won their respective groups. "It's going to be great whoever we play, even if we don't get either of the two English teams."
llama3.2:1b: David Beckham expressed relief at Real Madrid's Champions League knockout phase passage due to last season's under-achievement. He stated that winning would bring momentum back for the club and players. Real could face Arsenal or Chelsea in the next round, but their path is uncertain, with Manchester United also a potential opponent.
llama3.2:3b: David Beckham expressed relief that Real Madrid qualified for the Champions League knockout phase after a 3-0 win over Roma, saying another season of underachievement would not be tolerated at the Bernabeu stadium.
gemma2:2b: David Beckham expressed relief at Real Madrid's passage to the Champions League knockout phase, stating that another season of underachievement would not be tolerated.  He noted their runner-up finish in their group means they will likely face a different Premiership opponent in the next round, but expressed excitement regardless as it promises an engaging matchup.

Real could be drawn against Manchester United in the next round but lost 3-0 to Roma, and their finish as runners-up is expected to give them an advantage over Manchester United in the next round.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Beckham expresses relief that Real Madrid advances to Champions League knockout phase after 3-0 victory over Roma, aiming for a title without Manchester United or English clubs in next round.
qwen2.5:3b: David Beckham expressed relief after Real Madrid defeated Roma 3-0, securing passage to the Champions League knockout phase. He emphasized that another underwhelming season would not be acceptable at the Bernabeu and acknowledged Real's need for success in order to avoid a repeat of their poor finish last year. Real's group stage second place means they won't face Manchester United in the next round but could potentially draw against other Premier League hopefuls such as Arsenal or Chelsea. Beckham noted that it would be great regardless of who they play.

Beckham relief afterReal Madrid's Champions League passage. Real's 3-0 win againstRoma highlighted their under-achievements but expected success at Bernabeu. Real faced Manchester United in next round but could face Arsenal or Chelsea instead. Beckham expressed excitement for future encounters with other Premiership hopefuls.
tinyllama:1.1b: Beckham expressed relief as Real Madrid progressed to the Champions League knockout phase without having to face their arch-rival Manchester United. The England skipper admitted the under-achievement in recent seasons would not be tolerated at the Bernabeu stadium, adding that Real could potentially face other Premier League clubs in the next round of the competition. While Real can't face Man Utd in the next round, Beckham expressed hope that they could meet another Premier league team in the draw. Despite finishing second in their Champions League group, Real was able to progress due to losing momentum last season but could potentially be drawn against other Premier league hopefuls like Arsenal or Chelsea in the next round.
tinydolphin:1.1b: The text is about David Beckham's reaction to Real Madrid securing a place in the Champions League knockout phase with a win over Roma. He acknowledges their hard work and admits that it won't be easy for them not to make it through another season without success. Meanwhile, Real Madrid fans can breathe a sigh of relief, knowing they'll be facing other teams who have done well in the group stages.
phi:2.7b: David Beckham is relieved that his former club, Manchester United, will not face Real Madrid in the Champions League knockout phase. He also believes Real Madrid's passing through is expected and a relief for the club and players. The team was disappointed with their last season's performance but will not tolerate another season of under-achievement. They have finished as runners-up in their Champions League group, which means they cannot face Manchester United in the next round. However, Real could be drawn against other Premiership hopefuls, Arsenal or Chelsea, who won their respective groups.

granite3.1-dense:2b: David Beckham, England captain and Real Madrid player, expressed relief following his team's 3-0 victory over AS Roma, securing their advancement into the Champions League knockout phase. Recognizing that another season of underperformance would be unacceptable at the Bernabeu, Beckham emphasized the importance of winning, stating, "We lost momentum last year but can't afford to go another season without a trophy." Real Madrid's runners-up status in their group eliminates them from facing Beckham's former club, Manchester United. However, they could potentially be matched against other Premier League contenders like Arsenal or Chelsea, whom they didn't defeat in their groups. Despite the match outcome, Beckham remains enthusiastic about whichever team they'll face next round.
